hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Vacuum Reversal at Regime Boundaries
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC approaches key liquidity levels (previous monthly high/low ±2%) during NEUTRAL regime with order book depth dropping to <50% of 30-day average, a false breakout occurs and price reverses 1.5x the initial penetration distance within 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Thin order books near historical levels create liquidity vacuums. Market makers pull liquidity to avoid getting picked off, creating exaggerated moves that often reverse when real volume arrives. The absence of strong funding rates suggests lack of directional conviction.
entry_conditions: Price within 2% of previous monthly high or low
Order book depth (2% each side) < 50% of 30-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reverses 1.5x the distance it penetrated beyond the liquidity level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond liquidity level by >3% with increasing volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such low-liquidity approaches to key levels result in sustained breakouts rather than reversals when analyzed across 2022-2024 data.
